slC-3Vfp5eIMbEnxDPFYdQ.text: So, being from the US and not the UK, I have to compare this experience with food that I am accustomed to as well as other food in the UK. But, I do try to have an open mind. Overall, it was one of the better meals so far in the country (had a pretty mediocre experience so far in the UK) but it did not meet better-than-average food standards that I am familiar with....OK, I say all of this cause I know this may not be a fair assessment and it sounds like I'm an Ameri-snob but that is what I'm working with....  We were staying near the Royal MIle and had passed by this place on a few walks. Decided to head out to have lunch there. Upon arriving, it was raining (outdoor seating closed) so we were immediately led to the back dining room. A very pleasant, modern space with a wall of glass on one side. Waiter came within a few minutes and got a drink order and an orange juice / seltzer mix for the kids.  My wife got a pink froo-froo drink that came in a Martini glass and didn't like it (as usual). I tried it and it was OK...just not her thing. She switched to wine. I got a Hendricks Negroni which was really good and stout if you like bitters.   Thing 1 and Thing 2 ordered kids penne pasta (not on the menu)....one with just butter and one with a red sauce. Red sauce was a bit weak and flavorless. Wife and I shared a scallop app that was pretty good...had a salad with cilantro and a mayo-based sauce on the side.   Then came the main courses....wife got the salmon med rare and I got the fish and chips. Salmon was reported as just OK and fish and chips were good except for that English tradition of serving things with mushy peas underneath them. Not too bad of an idea, and I don't have anything against peas, but the they need to have some flavor so that they enhance the dish and this wasn't the case. A bit bland. Tartar sauce accompanying my dish as well as the "chips" were tasty. The presentation was very nice here.   Check was 120 pounds which seemed very steep (hmm....is this about $200 USD!!!! ouch). But, very good service. I would say that there are many other places to eat in this town....I will have to try a few more before I can compare this with other options in the area. Probably won't be back here on this trip.

HUvOFCchn4HR1tCUcKr8RQ.text: Just so everyone knows you need a reservation!!! My mother & I went without & they squeezed us into a front 2 top table which was worth it because this place is amazing! We saw many people try to come in but they were full with reservations all night. We got a goat cheese appetizer which was amazing with apples & beets! We split chateaubriand with green beans, potatoes & rocket salad.... it was wonderful! The waitress was so attentive & pleasant as well! we had a wonderful time so happy we found this place!!!!

bumrzr0tvuSVeyuTAhbOAg.text: After going to many restaurants this past week, I'd have to say this spot was Alright.   I think overall its just because I seem to have made the bad choice on the menu! I ordered Fish with Squid and some sort of chorizo risotto underneath. I have to say the dish was so salty I was considering taking it back. The other dinners were nice, all the presentation is well done and the staff were really kind. Although this choice that I made put me off, especially because the prices are pretty high.   For a starter my dad and I shared a goats cheese and beetroot ensemble. It was very delicious and the presentation was cool enough that my family and I want to re-create it at home.   The prices are high, the service and ambiance is nice, however I just don't think I'd rush back ASAP.

68IdsBfNb2BRIFVLuDpuRw.text: I had one of the more adventurous meals of my life at Angels with Bagpipes last week, and it was excellent.   As we were on vacation, we decided to treat ourselves to a more upscale and pricey meal, and it was worth every penny. We had a late reservation, and our table wasn't quite ready when we arrived, so we decided to enjoy a cocktail in the front bar area and peruse the menu. It's not a huge menu by any means, but it is an interesting one, so we had a difficult enough time deciding what we'd like to order. What was nice was that we were able to order prior to being seated at our table, so that we wouldn't have to wait ages for our food. (Details like that are what make some restaurant experiences great, instead of merely good.)  My cocktail (a chocolate/orange/espresso combination) was tasty, but I switched to wine with my food. My husband loved his gin and tonic, though, and stuck with that for the evening. I started with the beef tartare (a first for me), and it was amazing. I even enjoyed the raw quail's egg on top, and I generally have an issue with even somewhat runny eggs. Honestly, this dish was so good, I would've considered having it again for dessert! My husband had the haggis, which he really enjoyed, especially as it was wrapped in bacon. (I didn't get a bite, but I've had haggis before, so I wasn't too disappointed.) For mains, I had the trout, and again, it was very good - I particularly enjoyed the crab "fish stick" that accompanied it. My husband had the lamb, and here's where I got super adventurous, as it came with sweetbread and tongue, both of which I tried (another first), and coming from someone who SWORE they would never eat any kind of organ meat, I really liked both. The tongue in particular was very tender and flavorful. I don't know that I would be brave enough to eat an entire entree, but the bites I had were very enjoyable, and my husband said he'd happily order this again. He also got a side of chips, which were good, but not entirely necessary.  For dessert we decided to split the cheese plate, and it is more than big enough to share, with 5 different cheese on offer, including a fantastic goat cheese. The pear chutney was a wonderful accompaniment, and really, it was a perfect end to a perfect meal.  The restaurant isn't terribly fancy or pretentious - it's more of a place where you can dress up if you'd like to, but I felt comfortable enough in nice jeans and a sparkly top. The upstairs dining area can get a bit loud, especially if there are any large groups having dinner, but it didn't detract from our experience at all. Service, especially in the bar area, is friendly and top notch, and the food is all presented beautifully. Portions aren't huge, but everything is of the best quality and we certainly didn't leave hungry.   We had a great night and a fantastic meal, and I would definitely go back to Angels with Bagpipes if I'm ever in Edinburgh again.

dwxUyvhns0VrJpou5EVyWw.text: The ambiance here is great. The food presentation is great. The service is great as well and the above is why I give it 3 stars. The food was not all that though. Portions were very small and not that tasty. One person with us had the venison and liked it though. Tried the Hagas and it was good. Over priced place overall though. Again service was awesome though.

H_ksipGUMUuGe-agBLhquA.text: I have no doubts about giving this excellent restaurant just up the hill from St Giles five stars! The scallops were really wonderful and the sirloin was excellent. The sides of mashed carrots and greens were different and excellent. I particularly appreciated the very light dressing on the greens. We capped it off with a quite imaginative desert. The Romanian wine was very nice, the first glass we have ever encountered, anywhere. Finally, the service was exceptional. Enjoy!

G1vxCPMYlYFwn6ROjkyc9w.text: This place is my #1 favorite restaurant in Edinburgh. It was recommended by our hotel staff. We didn't have the chance to come here until the end of our trip. We wish we learned more about this place sooner because it was one of the best restaurants we've gone to. Everything was just exceptional! We were seated immediately when we came here. I've always wanted to try the haggis but didn't had the courage but something about this place finally made me try it. We ordered their haggis, neeps and tattis as an appetizer and it was very good. It was served it a very nice fashion. Not only the appetizer but everything else we ordered were served very nicely. My boyfriend and I couldn't decide between their lamb and venison so we decided to order one of each and shared. They were both very delicious. Good meat cooked to perfection as I almost licked my plate. We also decided to try some whisky. We didn't know what to order but our waiter helped us picked the best one they have. We didn't know how to drink it so he taught us how to add little drops of water into the whisky and drink it very slowly. We felt like dummy amateurs when it comes to whisky but our waiter was just so sweet, nice and kind. This place has very nice ambiance (not to mention very romantic), very good location (just around the corner from our hotel), exceptional food and service and reasonable price. I also like the restaurant's name Angels with Bagpipes.

qo4pnPsqlJhDmcwmxFAq7g.text: To be upfront, I have not eaten at AwB - I haven't even left the front room..  so granted, this review is somewhat skewed.  But from the looks of the place and menu, and attentiveness of the waitstaff and host while we just had a couple glasses of wine (great selection on that I can at least vouch for!) - I highly recommend making a reservation ASAP.

RnaTEYVqAjFEZLl3yHHOSQ.text: Angels with Bagpipes was recommended by the concierge of our colleague's hotel. Happily for us they even had a table available.  This is not a cheap restaurant, but we were being treated, so price wasn't an issue. Pretty much everything we had was great. The soup -- celeriac cream, foie gras & crouton -- was mild but lovely, the haggis -- my first time -- was surprisingly tasty, and my husband's beef tartare was one of the best I've tasted.  For mains, I got the lamb and my husband had the risotto. The lamb was perfectly medium rare, as ordered, and very flavourful. The polenta balls were great, but the peas and broad beans were a little overcooked -- starchier than I like. The risotto was quite nice; the mushrooms were particularly well prepared.  For dessert, I had the fig tart, which was good, but not spectacular. The vanilla ice cream was quite good, but the crust and custard were just okay and the tobacco syrup was disappointing -- just tasted like corn syrup to me. However, our colleague had the cheese platter, which was quite generous in quantity and had a nice variety of soft and hard selections. Definitely enough to share.  Servers were courteous and helpful, and when my husband spilled my port right after it had been served, they kindly refilled my glass on the house. We closed the place out, but the servers did a good job of not making us feel rushed. Our colleague, who knows more about these things than we do, seemed pleased with the wine list, as well.  All in all, we had a wonderful meal, and I would be very happy to return to try more of the menu (and get my own beef tartare!). Not quite 5 stars, but definitely 4.5.

GnzIXVxz4d3qxvdTMLz8Pw.text: In comparison to all other restaurants we ate at during our trip to Scotland, Angels with Bagpipes was pretty good. Had dinner there on our first day in Edinburgh based on recommendation from the local & experienced our first (but definitely not last) Haggis. Lamb was very flavorful, but a wee bit too tender. The name of the restaurant actually references three small angels with bagpipes engraved in a church across the street. The church is worth visiting too.

4blhn9oDykQiM0RRq-BFrg.text: Very good food and friendly service.  The menu is not huge, but original and dishes are made with local ingredients.  I would highly recommend Haggis and smoked salmon to start. We had lamb and cod for main course.  Cod was just about perfect.    Cannot beat the location - right on the Royal Mile.  We had a table for two next to the window overlooking the Royal mile.  Most of the restaurant is down stairs, so if you want the view, you should us for a table on the first floor.    Well worth the time and money.

_YgYKprabUSPDRNNOubtdQ.text: Great restaurant, lovely staff and gorgeous food. Sadly we only had an hour in which to enjoy as we had a show on at the Assembly Halls but I will be back to enjoy a more leisurely dinner and I would not hesitate in recommending AWB to all

c4A_p4aCLZeI5ucvbHrAlg.text: The best Scottish food experience we could have asked for.  The staff at the Bonham Hotel made the recommendation and reservations for us.  The beef tartar, ribeye and rabbit loin wrapped in panceta were simply DELICIOUS!  It was fantastic!!

W5Mi-Bru6FF1NqueaU7d9A.text: 4.5 star food and service. Went there for lunch, the seafood were delicious. Really enjoyed the place. (Try chow powder)

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

-lr3OAYpChVe_IcgzTVFDw.text: Went here for lunch when couldn't get reservation for dinner and everything was lovely - the salmon starters, the rabbit , lamb and polenta. The two and three course lunch menu is a great value. Not very diverse menu but all excellent.

JcHeqiIxGd1kr6EVB-MFkw.text: I've only been here once for dinner. The place is reasonably priced and the food and service were good. I had the scallops to start, followed by the venison and then the chocolate brownie for dessert. It was overall a satisfying meal and I would return again.

22UsjSnbOXynsVX7yTUitw.text: As it was Joe A. and my one year anniversary on Saturday, what better opportunity to try out Angels with Bagpipes! It had been on our radar for a while and now we've finally been.  The staff are lovely and friendly. They are very polite and go out of their way to accommodate you, but without being over the top.  The menu is mouthwatering and did not disappoint. I had a smoked salmon starter. The attention to detail was spot on. The piece of salmon was nice and chunky and garnished with bits of caviar, radishes, etc. Beautiful.  For my main course I unusually (not a big meat eater) went for the lamb. It was cooked beautifully and was really tasty.  Although I was pretty stuffed, I still managed to squeeze in a dessert of a chocolate orange mousse. It was nice but would have been nicer if it was a bit lighter. A bit too rich after the other courses.  My only criticism would be that it was a bit chilly in there. Apart from that it was a nice, relaxing environment, friendly and down to earth staff, and the food was delicious. I wouldn't go here all the time, but it is nice for a special occasion :)

RmPwzp2dsKa_eWJ6pIUkNg.text: Heavy handed with customers.   We agreed for the restaurant to precharge our credit card GBP 80 on reservation, because it was busy.  When we we showed up, they had given away our reservation to another customer but decided to keep the deposit anyway, and offered to seat us in the waiting area.  Took 15 mins of heated discussion with the manager and the credit card company to get our money back.

BQqOKvYn6dhncE0syXzSWQ.text: We had a really nice lunch here - i felt a bit sloppy and underdressed in my super-tourist apparel but the place isnt stuffy and we felt welcomed.   the soup -- cauliflower veloute -- was quite memorable, as was the side dish of carrots perfectly cooked, with cumin seeds.    Service is a little on the clueless side for an upscale place, but was well-intentioned.

qyvqNQSz7R_wFc562RKS8Q.text: Lunch deal 14 pounds.  Place is nice an audience also nice.  Food was good, but could be better,  Fois gras-very good Salmon-ok - Chicken-boring no flavor Beef ribs- really good  I think this is a really good place so i like to return and thats why i give it 4 stars.

vbONltsz9wYYM4R6y-GA_g.text: Very good service, great food! Beautiful sweetbread with the lamb. To be honest, the first time I had a proper meal while being in the UK...

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

StW5a5ZhU7Hqq3nJ-xYV1Q.text: I had eagerly awaited my reservations at Angels with Bagpipes for three months before actually dining there! We sat in the basement and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. I would suggest starting with the haggis with neeps and tatties (surprisingly delicious!) and smoked salmon appetizers. For my main, I had the lamb rump and belly with lentils and it was cooked to absolute perfection. My friends pumpkin risotto was also a hit. For dessert, we got the ginger honey pear cheesecake, the chocolate brownie with miso ice cream and the tonka bean parfait with green apple sorbet. These desserts were so unique in their components and I would have never guessed that they would have been as delectable as they were. I also had several bottles of the Thistly Cross Cider and it was one of the better Scottish ciders I had tried. Plan on this being one of your more pricy dinners, but the overall experience, the quality of the food, and the uniquely satisfying flavors are an experience in themselves!

z4bru2rNkJDFHpGCB4-SEg.text: Wonderful restaurant worthy of a Michelin Star (so said the London Restauranteur who was seated with  us).  Portions are perfect size and the food is rich and we'll prepared. We had pork belly (a must!), roasted beef (fork tender and extremely tasty).  Servers were helpful and got us in with no reservations but we'd recommend you get them as this place is fantastic.

hvX2QyBujmzVMMksQsYWwg.text: Excellent restaurant.  We had scallops, sole and salmon.  All were perfectly cooked and delicious. Service was very good. Atmosphere very enjoyable

8wrlB3XWFUva5-XZJlvDZg.text: Visiting from the US, I relied on Yelp and OpenTable for reviews to find a restaurant for dinner. I was intrigued by the name alone, and the food was absolutely incredible. Each bite was more delicious than the next. The most fabulous beet and goat cheese appetizer, creamy creamy creamed potatoes (side), flavorful entrees- salmon and duck, and an elegant and delicious dessert. If you're looking for a restaurant in Edinburgh, do not miss this one! It's in a great location on the Royal Mile but is certainly not a tourist trap; there were locals dining alongside other visitors.

LFjatKolA8FZtkbILsq2UA.text: Nice wine list, great service, excellent, modern food selections in the prix fixe.

lZyBzOpWlOHcvTO0mK7t4Q.text: I loved this restaurant!. We had the A la Carte menu ( less than 20) for 3 courses. The Portions were not massive, but we still felt very full, so much so that i could not  finish my Creme Brulee! Very tasty! Staff very polite and spotless inside. Nice for date or two!

yYWc_vvrqLfT80uH7Xwpig.text: We, unfortunately, did not enjoy our dining experience here. Our hotel made the reservation for us and, upon arrival, the first two staff members at the restaurant could not find it. Eventually a third person was able to locate it (he was, possibly, the manager). We then sat for almost ten minutes before any waitstaff came to our table (despite the fact that we were seated right next to the hostess' stand). From that point on, we would describe the waitstaff as "inattentive", at best. The food was good - we had the tasting menu - but the service was really pretty bad. Unfortunately we cannot recommend this restaurant.

qKNgfWIGn49HVF2yS9-5Ew.text: My boyfriend and I are in Scotland for a weekend out of town. We enjoyed a nice bottle of Rioja, a chateaubriand that came with rocket and Parmesan, green beans and shallots, and chips. The atmosphere is nice and classy, and the staff is friendly. Would recommend!

6utQ6UimGjsP9FOjlEbykw.text: While visiting Edinburgh on our honeymoon, my husband and I stopped into Angels with Bagpipes because it was highly recommended by a local we met earlier on our trip. We weren't prepared for the atmosphere and totally stood out like tourists. But, we were so anxious for a good meal because we hadn't found one yet.  The service was impeccable and we didn't feel a hint of disdain at our shorts and tennis shoes attire (whoops - like I said, unprepared).  We ordered olives, bread and olive oil as an appetizer. I had the pork belly, which I think I remember being served with potatoes and greens. No matter, the pork belly was the focal point and it was just perfect. My husband ordered the ribeye with and to date, he still describes it as the best steak he's ever had in his life.  We didn't do dessert, because we headed across the street for a fried Mars Bar. How could we not?

88MGWuKppPIslxedggde-g.text: I'm from the US so I'm picky and must say that I have yet to find any memorable food in the UK.  The food and service here were good.  If we could give 3.5 stars..I would give this place 3.5.  That being said, I would go back here for the food.

mrCwWoV_sEHVMLYZAc-udQ.text: My boyfriend took me here for my 25th birthday as a surprise.  I had a lovely goat's cheese for a starter, a perfect steak for the main course and we shared a wonderful chocolate mousse with salted caramel and peanut butter ice cream.  The lights were dim and from where I sat you could look out on the twinkling lights in the window. Very good food and a cery romantic setting!  Maybe a bit pricey for us as students but worth it!

ykJqGP9mvj3Hd4Uef06VuQ.text: We got the distinct impression they don't like gay people here.

6In6NT0ftw_NpFPP5f280A.text: What a wonderful treat this restaurant was! The food was delicious, the staff friendly, and the atmosphere was great. The scallops were amazing! Will definitely return next time we visit Scotland.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scrumptious peanut butter brownie with salted caramel ice cream
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Loved the presentation of the salmon

309-nliN2yJj2Hy56G6dXA.text: We stopped into this beautiful little restaurant right on the Royal Mile for lunch.  We were a party of 9 in the large table near the front door.  I'm sure there is more seating here if you were to take the stairs behind our table, but from a first glance, there weren't many tables.  The lunch menu offered three courses, with the lunch special being a choice of two.  Many in my party ordered (and enjoyed) the mussel appetizer.  I chose an entree (beef with creamed potatoes, leek and truffle oil) and dessert (Chocolate mousse with white chocolate sorbet and Seville orange gelee).  The menu wording weren't quite as descriptive as mine, but I rolled the dice.  The beef was more like a pot roast, quite marbled with fat.  I really dislike red meat that isn't on the leaner side, so the beef wasn't for me.  I ate the remainder of the entree, combining the potato, leek, and sauce and actually rather enjoyed it.  My dessert, however, was to die for!  Not too heavy, but still so decadent, and the seville orange gelee was the perfect addition to the chocolates!  I couldn't get enough!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunch entree - beef with creamed potatoes, leek &amp; truffle oil
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunch appetizer - mussels
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunch dessert - chocolate mouse (mint leaf in top), white chocolate sorbet, Seville orange

QP3r5ytGAFeq1MB3dzWxMw.text: We had a marvelous dinner last night! The beef and lamb were so tender and tasty. Desert was gorgeous and tasty! The staff was friendly, especially Alice! Just make reservations in advance! It's very popular!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The beef! Tender and tasty!
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The lamb.. Yummy!

onroAa5ogg1Jlfqr6UZEbQ.text: We tried the tasting menu and we could barely keep up with the pace of the wines at this place !! The food exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

rQdFlbRxFQcUp6D3nHa6uQ.text: In 2012, I ate at this wonderful restaurant twice while attending a conference in Edinburgh. I was back in town a few weeks ago and had the good fortune to snag a table without a reservation. I was delighted to find that it is still an outstanding place to eat. I had a lovely meal. Excellent food, beautiful presentation, great wine list, perfect service. The restaurant is on many levels, so it is a bit of a maze (especially to find the restrooms).

dyKS2OzrkGaDD2kukz5hQQ.text: Food was fine, but whole experience was overshadowed by arrogance of the staff who greeted (and I use that term loosely) us as we entered. They apparently play a keen game of "where did you fit in our restaurant" and will either reward you with a seat in their one good dining room, or down a notch and put you in their adequate room, or stick you next to their station where they can make you feel perfectly miserable about dinner so that you will leave quickly. One poor family even fell below that, and got dispatched to a table outside in the cold Edinburgh weather. Not even sure why they stayed, and it was clear to all what was happening. Chef needs to take her/his skills to one of the other hundreds of restaurants in town where the staff appreciates guests and their revenue. So many excellent restaurants nearby, pass in this one and save yourself the trouble.

k5NMDqcXaA2jj12uVqxfTA.text: Spectacular dinner at a wonderful restaurant. Had the smoked salmon followed by the rabbit loin. Complemented well by two excellent bottles of wine and great ambiance.  Exceeded all expectations for a dining experience in Edinburgh.  Highly recommended.

cuvzgq4gq1kb2BmD7gnxcA.text: We had the best dinner here with really good wine.  This was hands down the best food in Edinburgh. The ambience is modern and bright.  The staff is excellent. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

__IpZlHuzIDiOhC0NTVJyg.text: First night in Edinburgh and after wandering around looking for somewhere to eat we decided to check this place out. Very happy we did!   The host was very friendly and gave us a nice selection of non-reserved seats so we sat in the lower dining room. Very beautiful room with a lovely ambiance. The server was also quite friendly and made a good wine pairing suggesting for my wife's duck main. She started with the haggis and it was very delicious! So many people were asking if we were going to try haggis while we're over here. We've had it all three days we've been here so far. I ordered the lamb - which I've been excited for since we decided to visit Scotland - and it was also really tasty. Her duck dish though was better, served with beets and some asparagus, it was great. I do wish the portion sizes were slightly  bigger. Dessert choices were the panna cotta and ginger cheesecake. Both were great ways to cap the meal.   They do have tasting menus which I would try if we go back. They offer a 4 or 6 course menu and the option of having it paired with wine. It would be worth it.

nGMQDNoGZ20P5YTETQfyEg.text: Dinner at Angels with Bagpipes was very good and the service was exceptional.  Upstairs dining is cozy, but a little noisy when we were there.

FnF2Wseoyd7uknePGP--qw.text: I slowly opened one eye, and then the other, I checked all major body parts...everything was still there and moving. I lifted my head off the pillow, that's when I realised I had a very dry mouth and a gentle pounding in my head, it was time to get to the kitchen...must...drink....tea.  So now you know how the evening ended, it's time to go back to the start.  My dining partner in crime (DPIC) and I had decided on Angels with Bagpipes as the venue for a celebratory meal. We arrived to be shown promptly to our table by the friendly staff who immediately made us feel welcome and offered any help with questions while we perused the menu.   We were seated in the back area which reminded me of a friends living room that has impeccable taste in interior decor. It was relaxed yet with the perfect balance of formal and informal that makes you feel like you're somewhere special but not that you can't relax and enjoy yourself.  It didn't take long for us to make our dining decisions, we chose the Chateau Ka wine from Lebanon after a recommendation from my DPIC and we were not disappointed at all. I went for the Orkney Scallops with lentils, apple, caramel and crackling as I was intrigued by the combination of flavours for a starter and being a fan of a classic steak chose that for mains.  The scallops were tender and fresh, and the lentils added a wonderful texture perfectly balancing the sweetness of the apple and caramel, the crackling added a lovely 'bite' and it was beautifully presented. The steak was perfectly done to order, however the pesto tomato was a little over loaded with pesto but a small complaint given when you order steak it's the meat that's the star.  My DPIC ordered the beef tartare, and after stealing a fork full I can confirm it tasted wonderful with a wonderful crisp fresh crunch from the onions. For her main she ordered the lamb which was again perfectly cooked but she felt there was a little too much 'going on' with the sweetbread, anchovy and almond garnish. We're both of the opinion when it comes to a meat dish, less is more but this is personal opinion after all.  We decided to finish off the evening with a shared cheese board and some port, the staff again demonstrated their knowledge by walking us through the cheeses on the board and informing us they were displayed from mild to strong across the board. We ordered the Fonseca 97 Port as my DPIC informed me she still dreamt about the port from when she'd been in 2010. And it was everything it was built up to be, so we had a second glass just to be able to savour it a little longer.   The cheese was a good mix of hard and soft, and whilst we're both cheese fiends we didn't find the strongest one over powering and we easily polished them all off as the portion sizes were just right.  Overall we had a lovely evening there, I'd recommend this venue for special occasions with friends, romantic dinners or if you have friends from out of town staying. Make sure your guests spot the Angel with Bagpipes statue which the restaurant is named after, her whistful expression makes me think she also might be thinking of the glass of port and cheese she's going to have at the end of her shift.  Oh, and in case you're wondering. I can highly recommend the Jolly Roger and Monteiths and the Albanach for post dinner drinks. Probably just don't do them all in one night, otherwise you'll end up how I started this review!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

gybUOVAAppdY7pyvez8p-w.text: Well on the sunniest and warmest Tuesday of the year Kev.W and I stopped by for a spot of lunch attracted by the idea of 2 courses for 12.50. Given the reputation given below that this place can be expensive this was a pleasant surprise.  Looking at the fixed price menu there was something for everyone but for me starter wise there was only one option, smoked ham terrine with a fois gras centre served with a quail egg and a tweel. Light tasty and delicious! The dish was technical, elegant and just outstanding. The fois gras was a great treat on a beautiful day.  For main I opted for the short rib of beef, served with potatoes, salsify, spinach and a gravy that was incredible the dish worked fantastically well. I gobbled it all up in no time and was left very content.  The service was perfect, the beer was cold...I was very happy.  Even more keen to visit for dinner now but the lunch menu here comes highly JD Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Short rib of beef! So tasty
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoked ham and fois gras! Amazing!

sy-aO-VrVug2uwUNpPqsYw.text: Definitely not $$$.  This is some seriously affordable luxury, with a hostess that will check your coat, wait staff that will fold your napkin when you get up, and staff that will lead you to the restroom. ^_^ I absolutely adore everything about this place. From the posh atmosphere, the exquisitely plated food, the gracious service, seriously everything.  A prix fixe menu will keep costs down significantly . Though I went on one night and had a lovely dinner for two with wine and a shared dessert for less than 60.  Side note: there is a slippery spot in the back room that I hope they've polished over by now. Three woman slipped on it during brunch, me being one of them. One minute you're enjoying toast, and the next your skirt's flown up and you've flashed everyone the goods.  Still not enough to sour a great experience, haha.

OU9ihflioIp9iCACNuPKkQ.text: The desserts are the best! We had Lime and Raspberries. Great dinner. The mashed potatoes are scrumptious with garlic and chives and small chunks of potatoes mixed in with creamy ones. Great sole, leeks and steak. The beer Aces and Eights is a must. Great wine menu too!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

YgiFHdHN7H12NLitU-mkUQ.text: This place really deserves a 4.5  My stars...(5=epic "best of") (4=really tasty and want to go again and again) (3=good and will go back once in a while) (2=fair, might return for a visit if there was some glimmer of hope) (1=avoid at all costs)  Go or No?  Go!  Tease:  A local Edinburgh restaurant with a mix of traditional and modern Scottish food.    Why I went:   We found this place on Open Table when travelling through Edinburgh.  It was well rated.  When:  Summer 2011  Food:  I cannot recall what my wife ordered, but I had haggis raviolis in a scotch reduction sauce that were out of this world!  To the best of my recollection, everything we had was very tasty.  Service:  Very efficient and friendly.  Hints/Final thoughts:  Give this place a try!  It's fairly fancy and a great date spot!  The food is eclectic and tasty!

sHxp6VO3NxLWndT3cPWzWA.text: Elegant, cozy atmosphere.  Attentive and friendly service.  We had the two-course fixed price meal.  Great flavors throughout.  A bit pricey overall, but it was a very nice dinner.  Easy location a short walk from the castle and other sights, across from St. Giles church.

w6HCekgARkQg9PnGo_Jk1Q.text: I've been here a few times now, it's my go-to restaurant when my family visit me in Edinburgh. Originally visited after a friend recommended it to me. Food is amazing, so well made and the atmosphere here is great - caters for all groups well. On my first visit I was dubious as there were a large group of hens- they didn't ruin the atmosphere (even though it's a small-ish restaurant), waiters were really attentive. A friend knew we were visiting and had pre-ordered a bottle of prosecco for us which was a really nice surprise! It's nice to visit for a romantic dinner or with friends.   The service is great - such a pleasure dining here, and there's something for everyone on the menu.. Just wish the deserts were't so damn tasty!

2OZQmYWBkSx6HXAisLjHkQ.text: Great food and outstanding service.  Dined on a Sunday evening.  Made a reservation and were seated immediately upon arrival.  Food options were solid, with food types for all members of the party.  Food was delicious.  Servers were on point.  Will definitely return.

xQuEp3zt_8XFchEk6tEQuQ.text: I really liked it in here. They have a private-ish table which has a window onto the alley way which I tried to get but it was already reserved unfortunately. Next time I will try to book that table.  Where I sat was not so nice - right by the front door and being mid December they were hosting multiple christmas parties for companies so large groups of people were coming through the doors and being a polite bunch they kept the doors open for the next person - even if they were on the other side of the street..... Making it nice and freezing for myself and the wife! I mean really, it was like a gale wind coming in.   Why do restaurants have tables right by the doors - so close in face I could have probably held it open for them with a little stretch of the arm! It's not like they were short for space, they have 2 floors and many tables.   Oh well - I'll get the private table next time hopefully.

Z9sLmpo3RrMhersbIDClwQ.text: So impressed with the first meal, with every bite delicious and perfectly executed, we just had to sample other dishes on the menu and ate here again the same week!  From the first meal, the haggis appetizer was our first introduction to the dish, and was a great balance of the richness of the offal with the spice. The rabbit dish was a surprise in presentation as a stuffed roll, but expertly cooked and tender. The seasoning on the barley was rich and delicious as well, with wonderful sauces to accompany.   Our second meal, I loved the minty "salsa verde" on the potato terrine beside the lamb, perfectly cooked to rare and tender. The parfait dessert was light with punches of oat, raspberry, and whiskey flavor, an upscale version of the Scottish dessert cranachan I believe.  Both times, we had the greatest service by Cecily. Her cheery demeanor was a joy in helping us make our decisions on the menu. She really conveyed an enthusiasm for the food and restaurant that added a lot to the experience. Cecily immediately recognized us on our second visit with a warm welcome that confirmed that we had made the right choice in coming back!  Easily my favorite restaurant in Edinburgh. Head and shoulders over other steakhouse/seafood restaurants at similar price point we had tried.

Kqdbaai-X6NKANT1V05QuA.text: Very disappointed that we arrived 15 min before the kitchen closed for a quick bite and was turned away by a rude hostess. Won't ever be back

Fj_9HEnldfIZ8h4zcBy7Pg.text: Angels with bagpipes? If angels really did play bagpipes...infer what you will.  As a modern Scottish eatery, this is a gem.  Hidden in plain sight, right on the Royal Mile.  Traditional Scottish food elevated using the freshest obtainable ingredients served in a contemporary, multi story building overlooking centuries old courtyard.  The menu is seasonal. Autumn 2015, for starters, the potato and leek soup with a poached egg and croutons is outstanding. Creamy, the vibrant flavor of the leaks mellowed ever so slightly when you break the egg open. The scallop with black pudding, and unexpected joy to eat. Tart green apple puree provides the base for beautifully seared, incredibly sweet scallop. The accompanying black pudding has been deep fried in bacon fat rendering it crispy.  Barely a hint that it's a blood sausage. Crisp streaky bacon adds even more Porky goodness. Some bitter greens rounds out the extremely well balanced, textually satisfying dish.  For mains, it's hard to pass on the selection of fish. All combine intriguing flavors of produce that miraculously heightens the flavor of the fish. The salmon cooked mid rare is extremely rich. The crispy skin adds a brilliant foil. The use of a red pepper puree heightens the natural sweetness, bitter greens accentuate the fatty flavor.  The natural flavors of a simply pan roasted, perfectly cooked, moist and fatty, black cod are greatly heightened by the earthiness of grilled onions sauteed wild mushrooms and a root vegetable puree.  For something vegetarian, try the mushroom mouse served with grilled mushrooms and sauteed root veg, sauced with beet root puree is wonderful.  Solidified mushroom soup!  Extremely silky, velvety, intense flavor of mushroom from the mouse combines perfectly with the bitterness of the grilled mushrooms. The sweetness of the beet puree ties the entire dish together.  Very well chosen wine list at reasonable prices.  Average bottle 20.  Very friendly and efficient service.   One month advance booking required.   Them angels can play bagpipes all they want if I can eat like this.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mushroom mouse with grilled mushrooms, asparagus and roasted root v g with beet root purée
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Potato and leek soup with poached hen egg
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scallop with Black Pudding and Apple purée garnished with streaky bacon

T93W1X2pl7v41zZMN2y3Ww.text: The first thing you realize is that angels playing bagpipes would be quite the outsiders. While the other heavenly beings are composing etudes on their celestial harps, these rebels are making a scene while making music you can hear from miles away. As someone who has an affinity for people (and demigods) who follow their own path, I like these angels. And I can safely say Angels with Bagpipes is a restaurant that stands alone when it comes to outstanding service and impressive food.  Three of us walked in on a Friday night with a reservation made weeks in advance, and at first it looked like we may not have needed it. From the street, this looks like a small place with room for a dozen, or so, and the entrance appeared empty. And then the hostess walked us through the hallway and down the stairs. Suddenly, we were in a positively charming lower dining room with a large dinner party and four other tables full of patrons wining and dining. Angels with Bagpipes is much larger inside than it initially appears, and the place is brimming with warm lighting, ambience and a decor that is equal parts relaxing and the perfect backdrop for intoxicated selfies.  Our waitress, Alice, was excellent. We had spent the day walking the city and doing all the usual touristy stuff, so by the time our 8:00 reservation came around, we were on the verge of slap-happy exhaustion. Fortunately for us, Alice rolled with our questions and our thorough reading of the menus - from drinks to meals, there is a lot to look over! (Especially when a Flying Scotsman cocktail is ready to knock you right out of the chair you're sitting in.)  And in reality, the entire staff was made up of professionals who take their job seriously, but still do it with a sense of humor. Food runners were attentive but personable, the aforementioned hostess was friendly and the entire visit here absolutely earned the highest marks for service.  And then there was the food. Was it the best meal we had in Edinburgh? You'd better believe it was. While two of us started with jaw-droppingly tasty cauliflower soup, I decided to stamp "TOURIST" on my forehead and order the haggis. In reality, I was blending in with the rest of the dining room's regulars and out-of-towners, because more than a few of us were chowing down on what ended up being a delicious concoction of... well, if you don't know what haggis is, you may not want to find out. Suffice it to say, it was wonderful!  Entrees were just as delectable. The salmon and lemon sole looked good and tasted even better. And my rabbit was one of the best dishes I have ever had. (It was one of those dishes where you begrudgingly share it with your dining partners so they can also experience what you are eating, but you're secretly hoping they don't take you up on your offer so there is more for you to enjoy.) Cap it off with a brownie that was divine and you have a dining experience unlike any other.  I really cannot recommend Angels with Bagpipes enough. Much like the titular creatures trading in their strings for something different, this restaurant stands out from the competition by offering a tough-to-beat combo of excellent service and an even better menu.

bfuZTa3t7icvI9g6jiAmhw.text: Expectation and anticipation are my downfall! Service was great. The lamb was perfectly cook. Wine pairing was divine. But the green bean side dish wasn't what i expected; too chewy!

Gi5Ah_wPSr7BDGEqXoYGPA.text: The food is always absolutely incredible! I highly recommend the salmon as it was to die for!  A word of caution, this restaurant is categorized here as a pub. That's not entirely True. You often need a reservation and it's a bit fancier than the standard pub you have come to know and love around Edinburgh.   That being said, two big thumbs up for this lovely spot!

_zLycrdSp6JjfcCTXK53hQ.text: We saw rave reviews about the place and as it was our last night in Scotland, were really excited about having a great meal to top off our trip.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, the service was very good, but unfortunately the food ran the gamut from excellent (the lamb & chicken entrees were delicious and spot on, as was the beef tartare), to good (smoked salmon and the goat cheese appetizers) to awful (the chateaubriand).  The latter was ordered on the advice of our waiter, so when it arrived (well presented as it was) came out raw rather than pink as we were told.  They removed the plates and returned with more properly cooked portions but the meat was tough and chewy. We could literally barely cut and chew the stuff!!!  I will say that the waiter did everything he could to help recover and offered a glass of complementary dessert wine to our 2 unhappy companions.  It was a very nice gesture and much appreciated!  The wine list had some good choices and overall I would recommend the restaurant- just stay away from the meat unless you are a risk taker!

R1Se-rVs-j72steZZzDH7Q.text: Savoring each bite of my duck breast led me to a first time experience in what I have named a holistic cooking.   The taste of the duck meat, the juicy pac choi and the smooth beetroot stood all in their own independent fragrance, supported by delicious hints of sesame and cherry. And, altogether, they also mixed up in a majestic mesh that made my holistic gusto.   On top of this, finding such a high level of cooking mastery at these prices really surprised me. Never in my life did I meet such greatness and Angels with Bagpipes will be a must stop in my future visits to Edinburgh.

thoeH_TBQLKPeeA5ycuLzA.text: Despite being on the main stretch of the Royal Mile, this modern restaurant offers a sense of calm.  The a la carte menu offers quite a decent range of options, different meats, steaks and also, larger versions of some starters.  The set menu offered a decent range of choices too and so my friend went for mussels, slow cooked beef and rhubarb, custard, sorbet. All courses we enjoyed.   The other starters we tried were beef tartare-too vinegary but overall solid. The haggis was excellent. Different purees and sauces with haggis 2 ways offered a great starter.   My other friend and I shared chateaubriand for our main. This came with a choice of 3 sides, garlic butter and peppercorn sauce.   The beef was cooked well, the sauces were good and the sides were all delightfully and generously cooked with plenty of butter and cream. The right way. The mushrooms were particularly nice. My only complaint here is that I expected more beef for the money and the mash portion was rather stingy.  The apple dessert too was also good and every dish was presented with care.  Service was polite and friendly and we had a good time here.

2K-gl_t7_u3Xh_eCiJ4iYg.text: What a great restaurant this is! We came here on the first day of our Edinburgh vacation and this was such a perfect introductory dinner to this wonderful city.   My husband and I did the 6-course Tasting Menu with wine pairing, and we were quite surprised of how exquisite the food presentation was. The only thing I didn't care for was the pigeon (which was prepared medium rare), but my husband loved it and he ate what I couldn't finish.   Service was excellent! Each wine, along with each course, were presented quite beautifully. I took a star out because of the pigeon, and also the location of our table. It was in front of the coat closet/storage room and the hostess and waitresses kept going in and out of that room. Kind of ruined a romantic dinner with my husband. Oh well, whatchagonnado......

REQDBotl0E2XsQG-nVbh1Q.text: We were lucky to fund this spot in Edinburgh. It was suggested to us by a good friend but ski has excellent ratings on yelp.  The restaurant is located waking distance from the castle.  Definitely recommend making reservations.

7pMmXog1VHKuBPiP3F6Mog.text: Somehow being in the heart of the main tourist area hasn't affected how well they make a meal. This is a great spot for fancy food in the middle of a whole hubbub. The service is excellent, and the food is great. Although we had to sit in the lower level, it was bright, and still had a window to the outside. The decor is casual, but nice, making it very versatile for dinner with friends or a romantic meal.

AGshASn1V_7Bp2-ZbTPXAg.text: There is a reason this place has so many solid reviews.   The food is was incredible!    We were so excited for our reservation at Angels with Bagpipes after reading the reviews.  The staff was very friendly and very welcoming.   We enjoyed a nice bottle of pinot as well as some scotch to start.    For mains we had the scallops which came with ham hock, leek, cauliflower and squid ink. The other main we enjoyed was the salmon which was so fresh and flavorful (cooked to perfection).  For dessert we chose the Mascarpone which was topped off with strawberry, raspberry, mint, and chocolate.  Great date spot, a bit pricey but worth every penny. One of the premier restaurants in Edinburgh.

K-s6uZO2IHqFAoXCIM7t7w.text: It was one my friend's graduation day and we ended up coming here for dinner to celebrate. Make sure you have reservation for this place because you won't get a table otherwise your lucky. It's a small restaurant but centrally located on the Royal mile.   The place is pretty trendy and has the typical modern restaurant atmosphere. The menu has a good variety of first and second courses. We all opted out for the first course cause we didn't fancy anything on there but it had a couple of Scottish-esk selection like haggis and blood sausage.   For the main course, they offered venison, rabbit, fish, and steak. We all decided to get the 18oz chateaubriand. This dish is good for two people and they will ask you how you like your steak cooked... Rate, medium rare, etc. It also includes 3 different sides and 2 sauces. We asked our meat to be cooked rare and it definitely came out that way! The meat was not bloody and very tender. The meat was nice, but it was missing that meaty steak taste I like with this dish so I knew it wasn't age that long. You get plenty of meat, but the sides were pretty small servings as well as the sauces. The peppercorn and butter sauce however was amazing! For 55, it was decent and definitely satisfied my craving for steak.   The dessert selection was ok... Nothing really stood out for me. I was trying to be adventurous but also wanted something light since the meal was heavy so I ordered an apple dessert. This was a disappointing dessert and I wouldn't recommend getting it cause it basically was just cut up Granny Smith apples with caramel and a couple of crunchy sponge. I expected a lot more from this dish and we all joked around how this was more of a salad than a dessert. Highly disappointed since I'm a total dessert person and they could have easily created a better homage for the apple. My suggestion... Avoid this dessert cause the chocolate brownie and the cheesecake looked and tasted better.   The staff were all nice especially the front desk staff who helped us the whole night. They watched over us and made sure we were happy with things.   I'd come back to this place and taste the other dishes since the food was well cooked and flavourful. I like the trendy atmosphere and the location as well. The price of the dishes follows the norm of these type of restaurant, so that was good. Overall, it was a good experience that definitely help making my friend's graduation day, a little bit more special!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

o3LF6U0t1X3hqUNfDNCkUA.text: The other reviews have this place right - it is really good. We went late and the place was quiet. Attentive staff brought my wife local lamb that was perfectly prepared while I ordered the salmon. Perfection in preparation and presentation.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Best lamb we had in Scotland.
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Local Salmon with goodness.

puHK9oVLX8kP0N8vlNDwpw.text: I have been there twice and loved the food and experience both times.  Excellent service combined with wonderful food which manages to be both interesting and simple at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. You cannot go wrong with good friends and good food
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Well appointed

Oru4VAgkwV6Dm2kOYQfPAg.text: I went here based off a suggestion from a girl I worked with.  I am so glad I did.   While in Scotland, we ate here a few times.  Great food. Great atmosphere.  Great service.  It is located on the Royal Mile.  I have to say it was some of the best food we had in the UK.   Please note you may want to make reservations, they fill up fast and turn many people away.  They do have a bit of room on their street side seating, but don't count on it. It is a bit pricey, but really worth it. Samuel the hipster manager (very easy on the eyes)  kind of made the experience great as well.  HUGE FAN!

zPT42dDlMGZ_z19OrDJ_UQ.text: We ate here after hearing amazing things about this restaurant, and I can gladly say we were not disappointed. The staff was very friendly, and the food was absolutely delicious. Everything in the dish we ordered went together so well. After traveling through Europe for 6 weeks, I can honestly say that this was one of the best dishes I ate on the entire trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb dish.

pPSTipyVGpPddCa4yVAneQ.text: This place looks like an ordinary pub but it is much better than that. We actually had the best fish and chips of our long visit here. They also served a delicious cheese plate with native Scotland cheeses. Definitely worth checking out. Even though the atmosphere on the busy street was very hectic, once we got upstairs everything seemed quiet and the service contributed to a peaceful pleasant experience.

o379k75QohT00IhZMn3caw.text: The only reason I rated this 4 stars is because we were kindly asked to pay our bill and leave after having been there for 2 1/2 hours.  I know that is long for dinner, but the table behind us had been empty the whole time, and the service at the beginning of dinner was lackluster (we had a different waiter at first).  Otherwise this place was top notch.  We ate here for our last dinner in Scotland and it did not disappoint.  My friend and I both had the lamb rump, and my mother had the salmon.  We all cleaned our plates.  But the best part, for me, was the dessert.  The two desserts we had were the most beautifully deconstructed dishes I've ever seen.  I had the rhubarb crisp and my friend had something with chocolate , coconut and lime.  Both were so amazing, I wanted to lick the plates!  This was when the hostess came up and knocked a star off by asking us to vacate our table ASAP.  A little annoying when you're spending so much money, but not enough to ruin the overall experience.  I would definitely return here for the AMAZING food.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The delicious deconstructed Rhubarb Crisp!

dV0vK0xvBj-aanA6t3-Npw.text: People have asked "what would be your last meal"... I pick this place!  I have traveled to The Royal Mile in Scotland twice in the last few years and Angels with Bagpipes is a stop we've made both times.   I would recommend the salmon and mashed potatoes paired with a nice white wine. We sat on the front patio- which I really enjoyed because you get to watch people on The Royal Mile which is always interesting!

FwdCuiFWtmxsGs0hJvwaSg.text: Came here on the recommendation of a friend. I had some misgivings, considering it's on the Royal Mile, ensconced among the tourist shops and attractions. But since it came recommended, I decided to give it a shot.   Pro tip: don't go alone. Being a solo diner is tantamount to being a leper in full bloom. When I asked for a table for one, the hostesses looked at me like I had a third eye. They tried to hide their horror but subtlety isn't their strong suit.   Despite visibly available tables both outside and in the main dining room, the hostess informed me the *only* thing they had was "downstairs."  I guess being a solo diner, I shouldn't expect anything better.  At least they didn't make me sit in the alley by the garbage.   The hostess is working overtime to explain why "downstairs" is SO much better than where they let the rest of the normal people sit and where they keep the natural light and cool air. Save it, sister. Message received.   I sit at a table made for two that is situated halfway into a hallway (I sit in the chair not in the hallway). My hostess gushes about how so-n-so, my waiter, will be taking SUCH good care of me since I am lucky enough to be in the basement, I mean "downstairs." On the upside, the bathroom is ten steps from my table, just in case!  I sit with menus and tap water for a slightly longer time than would be customary. Maybe they're hoping someone is going to join me and save me from my solitude (but, really, who wants to sit in the hallway?).  So-n-so the waiter, who looks distractingly like a young, chubby, bespectacled, stubbly Russell Crowe, comes over, dispensing with formalities and asking me if I'm ready to order. I think they're trying to fast track me out of here at this point in case the hallway seat is in high demand.   I inform Russell that I would like to order a glass of wine first, if that's okay.  I order a glass of some very nondescript pinot blanc and gnaw on my rock-hard sourdough bread, dipping it in my olive oil and balsamic (sigh - when did this become the fall-back bread course?). But there's a twist! Normally the oil and vinegar is served on a plate to allow you to absorb oil AND vinegar. Here, it's served in a tiny bowl.   Physics lesson: the vinegar sinks to the bottom, which means if you want to get some of the balsamic on your bread, you've either got to go diving for it (and drown your bread in oil in the process) or you have to create a little whirlpool in the bowl, which I think is frowned upon in polite society.   Russell comes back to ask me again if I'm ready to order (that hallway seat is waiting!). I decide to give Russ the benefit of the doubt and ask him to recommend one of two appetizers I'm considering. Before I can get the two of choices out of my mouth, he blurts out "sea bass!" like a fisherman with Tourette's.   Since it was one of the ones I was considering, and it's paired with my glass of whatever-that-wine is, I take his recommendation. Mistake. This looks gross.   Piece of sea bass with skin on (pet peeve) and an ink cracker (presumably squid ink and ... styrofoam?) that looks like bubble wrap covered in tar. All floating on a bed of curry.   Once the fish skin is removed (ew ew ew), it's fine. I guess it's a good thing I didn't order the haggis appetizer (there was never a risk of that happening, btw).  The curry has nice flavor and mild heat, but it's consistency is a little thick - almost gelatinous. This cracker though...    I'm not sure why the seabass was paired with the boring wine, though. Maybe they're trying to move that out of the wine cellar in favor of something new...  All in all, I'd give this appetizer 2.75 stars out of 5.   While I wait for my main course, I notice that the soundtrack is unusual. Not Scottish. Not Italian (is this an Italian restaurant?). It's 70s R&B. Stevie Wonder's "Sir Duke."  Before that, that Tina Turner/Phil Spector tune. Okay.   Looking forward to my entree. 8 Oz filet with peppercorn sauce and a side of mushrooms and garlic. I wonder when it's going to get here...  I'll be there - Jackson 5 Let's get it on - Marvin Gaye?  Meat - not a great sear. Sea salt on top but still lacked flavor. Underdone. A little sinewy in places.   Mushrooms - great but where's the garlic?  Peppercorn sauce - sweetness yuck it's supposed to be peppery not sweet.   Fries? Who cares?  I'm nearly through my meal. Russell hasn't come by to check on me once. Maybe he sees I'm making notes and is freaked out?   Russell is being very attentive and jocular w the table of five next to me. I feel slighted.   I order a forgettable dessert and made my way out. No thank you, no nothing.   Customer service: 0/5 Atmosphere: not applicable (but it looked nice where they let the humans sit) Wine: 1/5 Food:  2.5/5 Value: 1/5 (way overpriced for the quality)

H4sP5sag5AnYm3K2tWeUKQ.text: Very nice food. The lamb is fantastic and the set courses are in reasonable price. We try the dessert and it surprised us a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Raspberry dessert
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Rib eye

B-IYyPXydsfQO70QYPqY7g.text: Outstanding. Diverse menu with lots of choices, including healthy fare. Good wine list. Has lots of space with private dining areas. The dessert was interesting a cheese sampler with nice crackers and a rhubarb with sorbet was recommended and great.

YaQGGrI9CejrGifF3DQNNg.text: I was saddled with the chore of picking all of our restaurants in Edinburgh...heavy is the Crown that Yelps??? Well except for The Witchery yelp.com/biz/the-witcher... And I must admit as we walked the Royal Mile and passed Angels with Bagpipes I thought, " what's with all the Lager Louts drinking outside the restaurant patio...this can't be a great restaurant!" (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...) Welp what you see on the outside isn't necessarily what you get inside. The Inside of Angels with Bagpipes is drop dead gorgeous: The restaurant is truncated into several different spaces...and it is not a terribly large restaurant which is a good thing! The food and service here are absolutely stunning: Each of the four of us agreed it was perhaps our best meal. From the cocktails, to the appetizers, to the mains, and desserts. My Cocktail the smokey old man was fabulous (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...). Just the right amount of smoke, peat, sweet ..awesome. The Haggis appetizer ( I actually love Haggis) was incredibly tasty (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...). All components worked to create subtle layers of texture and taste...creamy/crunchy smokey/savory. The Parfait of Chicken Liver and black cherries was also pretty to look at (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...) and wonderful to taste. We also liked the Polenta with wild leek and ricotta cheese (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...) Even a simple entree of Chicken breast was a work of art (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...) and wonderful to taste. My friend's Lamb dish was cooked and presented to perfection (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...). Desserts are great because they are not over the top, pretty to look at, and taste great. Our panna cotta was simple and executed well (yelp.com/biz_photos/ange...). Amazing wine list. Perfect Ambiance. Wonderful friendly service. If you are visiting Edinburgh this should be top of your dinning list!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis neeps &amp; tatties, black haggis, whisky sauce
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Parfait Chicken liver, black cherry, nasturtium, croutons
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskey sour

la_QDS8BrQqhF07Gnovwaw.text: The food is impressive and well presented and this restaurant is very deserving of its 4.5 star review. If I could award half stars I would really leave 4.5, as half a star would be deducted for the service.  I found our server relatively unhelpful/impatient/terse.  I would say she was fairly unfriendly compared to the other staff at this restaurant and I was pretty turned off after just ordering our drinks. Luckily the food made up for any negative impressions that I had.  We decided to take our chances with the chateaubriand (even though our server described it plainly as just a "large filet" when we asked how it was prepared).  We had it cooked medium rare which is really the only way you should cook a good cut of meat. Overall verdict: phenomenal. The meat is very very lean. You are offered two types of sauces: a butter sauce and peppercorn- I would highly recommend the butter sauce because butter makes everything better.  We did start with the haggis which was delicious- but I personally think haggis is tasty regardless of where you get it.  No dessert for us after 16+ ounces of meat.  Would I come back or recommend this place to others? Sure! It's definitely a nicer environment compared to the other pubs in the area and the meals are moderately priced.  The experience isn't like the Witchery so you can't come in here expecting that, but you would certainly have a nice evening here.

PiPMEDl8AQk0s-vFun7iog.text: Loved the food and the service.  The risotto was wonderful and the beef was tender. The pea soup tasted like fresh peas from a garden. Lunch was a great price for two or three courses.

acAzMeDssMF6Xph0jUNa8Q.text: Very interesting restaurant with good decor, service and a unique menu.  The chefs are talented for sure.  I had the venison and my wife had the steak.  We were both very happy with the food and overall experience here.

xQYtyJO_1I6mcrLpobykoA.text: Wow. Just wow. Came in without a reservation around 5:30 and were seated with no problem. We were seated downstairs- which was empty - but not for long! They quickly filled all 7 tables. Service was ideally attentive. Atmosphere was classy but welcoming of our casualness. We ordered the tasting menu which consists of 4 courses paired with wines. Outstanding. I highly recommend it.  It starts with a goat cheese and rose. From there is moves to a sea trout with Sauvignon blanc. Then a duck with primitivo (Zinfandel) and then a rhubarb sorbet with moscato. Perfect! And the price was very reasonable.

6X2-SiV9nJ7kiLixFwy44A.text: Absolutely loved my experience at Angels with Bagpipes. I'd heard about this place from a lot of family that had visited Edinburgh and so I went for a late lunch on a Tuesday.   We were able to order from the seasonal menu. Between my table we tried the Smoked Salmon dip starter, which was slightly cirtusy but the overall texture and consistency was great. For the main course I had the pasta dish with orecchiette, courgette, chilli, Parmesan, pine nuts. The pasta was quite cheesy but the chilli and courgette added nicely to the flavour. For dessert I had the apple puff pastry with vanilla ice cream, which also had a circle of cream around it. Quite difficult to eat cleanly, but it tasted amazing.  The staff were so sweet, never rushing us and always willing to answer questions. We were surprised at how easily we were able to be seated and, despite a staff change in the middle of our meal, the whole thing went smoothly.  The restaurant was also lovely and warm (a save in grace considering the almost freezing temperature outside).   Overall a super pleasant experience and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting and looking for a slightly more expensive meal than your average pub.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The delicious apple dessert

V_nkGzxbz22qwKwFG_oA1A.text: All I can say is Amazing! The location was good. The interior was charming. The service was attentive and helpful.  Starters Haggis was savory! It was my 1st time trying it. I figured it was my 1st time in Scotland, try local fare.   My husband and I decided to get the 2 person entree of the  Chateaubriand steak, 18 oz, and comes with 3 sides to share.  We ordered it to be prepared medium and they did not disappoint. The meat was tender and the right shade of pink. Our 3 sides to share: chips- perfectly crisp, green beans- flavorful and the right texture and wild mushrooms- delicious if you love mushrooms.   Our meal also comes with bread which was fresh.  It was my husbands birthday so it was nice to receive a complimentary glass of champagne.   We were stuffed but forced ourselves to have dessert since it was my husband's birthday. We went with the chocolate brownie. We wanted something small to share.   We would definitely come back again when we visit Scotland. Service, quality and location make this place worth coming back to!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chateaubriand steak, yum!
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

0opQLKaTV1Hx9KiQYNN92A.text: The food was very good. Small portions, so don't bring a big appetite. The wait staff was very helpful recommending places to go after we ate! They ran out of ketchup? Hmmmmm.... Oh well.

VbSaWA0P63Hn_TOOYYW02w.text: We had a great meal here. The fish and chip was sort of refined and minimalist. Very crispy. The mushy peas we're more fresher and less mushy than your typical chippy variety. Nice place with friendly staff.

D829fGIOmJhUOt-XB7HuLw.text: The hotel recommended this restaurant. We had a fabulous meal, great service, and outstanding view from our table. I had the Polenta and my husband had the Sole, both were wonderful. We started with the smoked salmon in cucumber sauce. It was smoked perfectly and melted in your mouth. My husband also enjoyed the whiskey of the month special. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Polenta
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sole

Ep8yY4QR0fZ87Bt5LRUvEg.text: Lovely place, had the beef tartare & the haggis. Beef tartare was wonderful, and the haggis was a nice creative preparation.

rJG08UWJKQ1m3uFRRfR0TA.text: This meal was a highlight to our trip! Service was fantastic, the space was quaint but romantic. We ordered al a cart but they have a great tasting menu too. My husband got the Hagis starter and I started w the Salmon. Both were just amazing. Oh and there was an amazing looking pumpkin soup on the tasting menu so the waiter made an exception and was able to bring me a bowl. It.was.amazjng. It had little pieces of prosciutto in it.  For main course my husband had the lamb and I had the rabbit. Also a good wine list and fun cocktails!   The full experience was great! I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hagis
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb dish
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_I2wHTp2Q4ymooOzLNDZ-g.text: This place was recommended to us and it was right near where we were staying. I didn't realize how nice it would be until we got there. We had some beef tartare which was amazing. I had the venison and I think it might be the best venison I have ever had. The food is amazing and you leave very satisfied.

f4t7zXEK9eGfRCKejiKJdQ.text: This was such a great experience and a fun first night in Edinburgh. The staff was helpful with wine selections and our food order.   I started with the rocket & Parmesan salad. A little tip: add a little of the balsamic vinegar/oil concoction you get with the bread to the salad. shared the Chateubriand. You can't go wrong with this selection!  You must add this to your list when you visit Edinburgh!

PuFYyyrijMQcD3so5j3s5g.text: Ever since I came here the first time, I have been a fan.  It is very central at a touristic place but the food here is of high quality.  On my second visit, I had the scallops with black pudding as my starter.  They were delicately seared and placed on bed of black pudding.  Unlike most black pudding which is heavy and greasy, here it was light fluffy and complements the scallops well.    For the main, I had pollock.  The fish was extremely fresh and has a clean taste to it.  Again every so recommended for people trying Scottish produce cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DRKjn980NTFQILPHAw1dYg.text: If I had the authority to grant a Michelin Star to Angels with Bagpipes, I would do it in a heartbeat. Their a la carte menu offers a wide variety of options - vegetarian, seafood, white meat, red meat - so there is certainly something for everyone. I opted for the smoked salmon appetizer and the rabbit loin entree, both of which were gorgeously plated and absolutely delicious. I will be sure to pay another visit the next time I find myself in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Rabbit Loin (£18.50) - black pudding, pancetta, pearl barley, carrot, kale
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoked Salmon (£8.95) - lemon, mascarpone, quail egg, horseradish
Photo of Angels with Bagpipes - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Complimentary Bread
